docs.snippet: Kevin Johnson, a former Suns player and the mayor of Sacramento, is leading the search for an executive director for the N.B.A.’s players union, which has been without one since February 2013....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kevin Johnson, a former Suns player and the mayor of Sacramento, is leading the search for an executive director for the N.B.A.’s players union, which has been without one since February 2013.
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column; Kevin Johnson, a former Phoenix Suns player and currently second-term mayor of Sacramento, is leading the search for an executive director for the NBA players union, which has been without one since February 2013; he has assembled a seven-person committee of business and sports executives to conduct the search.

headline.main: N.B.A. Players Reset Union Search With Kevin Johnson as Point Man
headline.print_headline: From Point Guard to Point Man in Union Search

docs.snippet: LeBron James topped the list of N.B.A. jersey sales for the sixth time. Kevin Durant was No. 2....
docs.lead_paragraph: LeBron James topped the list of N.B.A. jersey sales for the sixth time. Kevin Durant was No. 2.

docs.snippet: Knicks players conducted exit interviews on Thursday with Phil Jackson, the team’s new president....
docs.lead_paragraph: Knicks players conducted exit interviews on Thursday with Phil Jackson, the team’s new president.
docs.abstract: New York Knicks punctuate playoff-free season by conducting exit interviews with team president Phil Jackson; Carmelo Anthony repeats conflicting statements from six months earlier, saying again that he wants to remain with Knicks but also wants to explore his options in free agency; teams cannot begin negotiating until July 1, which means Anthony has time to mull over range of possibilities.

headline.main: Unmoved, Anthony Is Still on Fence Over Future
headline.print_headline: Unmoved, Anthony Is Still on Fence Over Future

docs.snippet: Parker, an all-American as a 6-foot-8 freshman, made his announcement in an essay in Sports Illustrated and is expected to be one of the top three players drafted....
docs.lead_paragraph: Parker, an all-American as a 6-foot-8 freshman, made his announcement in an essay in Sports Illustrated and is expected to be one of the top three players drafted.
docs.abstract: Jabari Parker, freshman forward at Duke, announces that he has played his final college basketball game and will enter the 2014 NBA draft.

headline.main: Jabari Parker of Duke Declares for N.B.A. Draft

docs.snippet: If they really want to contend for a title, maybe the Knicks should try a trade with the Los Angeles Lakers: Carmelo Anthony for Kobe Bryant....
docs.lead_paragraph: If they really want to contend for a title, maybe the Knicks should try a trade with the Los Angeles Lakers: Carmelo Anthony for Kobe Bryant.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column suggests that if New York Knicks really want to contend for a title, they should try for a trade with the Los Angeles Lakers, exchanging Carmelo Anthony for Kobe Bryant; holds that Phil Jackson needs to talk Bryant into somehow joining him in New York for one last great mission in both of their careers, setting the table for the Knicks to win another championship.

headline.seo: Trading Carmelo Anthony for Kobe Bryant Would Benefit Knicks and Lakers
headline.main: Unlikely Superstar Swap Could Aid Knicks
headline.print_headline: Unlikely Superstar Swap Could Aid Knicks

docs.snippet: Considered by many to be the 'Renaissance man' in the National Basketball Association (NBA), Spanish forward Pau Gasol is delighted finally to be the sole architect of his 'revival' as he eyes his playing future....
docs.lead_paragraph: Considered by many to be the 'Renaissance man' in the National Basketball Association (NBA), Spanish forward Pau Gasol is delighted finally to be the sole architect of his 'revival' as he eyes his playing future.

docs.snippet: A Mexican man who was killed by a U.S. Border Patrol agent in a remote mountainous area was shot twice in the chest after allegedly pelting the agent with rocks, according to an autopsy report released Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Mexican man who was killed by a U.S. Border Patrol agent in a remote mountainous area was shot twice in the chest after allegedly pelting the agent with rocks, according to an autopsy report released Friday.

headline.main: Autopsy: Border Patrol Agent Shot Man Twice
